page.title: 11DAIRY FARMING (COW CARE)
page.content: In summer the cows go out in the fields to graze.When the grass is short the cows go to another field and the farmers will tillage and slurry the short grass field to make it grow again.Then he can put the cows back on it.The farmer will keep some fields for sillaging,he will cut it then pick it up with a sillorator and lead it back with a trailer and tip it in a heap.Then he covers it with plastic and tyres to keep it dry.In winter the cows come into sheds,they eat sillage and are still milked.They lie in cubicles most of the day and have straw or sawdust to lie on.The farmer may raise calves.They drink milk from the tank but as they get older they eat barley and cake then they go out to eat grass.He will keep heifers for the milk herd but will fatten bullocks on cake barley and sugarbeet for beef.
